## Executive Summary

[YOUR COMPANY] proposes a comprehensive security assessment of [CLIENT]'s web application infrastructure. Our assessment focuses on identifying high-impact vulnerabilities that could lead to data breaches, financial loss, or service disruption.

Unlike traditional penetration testing that takes weeks and generates compliance-focused reports, our approach delivers:

- **Speed:** Assessment completed in 3-5 business days
- **Focus:** High-impact vulnerabilities only (no noise)
- **Actionable:** Clear PoCs and remediation steps
- **Value:** Fraction of the cost of traditional pentests

---

## Scope of Work

### In-Scope Targets

| Target | Type | Notes |
|--------|------|-------|
| [example.com] | Web Application | Primary application |
| [api.example.com] | REST API | Backend API |
| [admin.example.com] | Admin Panel | Internal tools |

### Testing Methodology

Our assessment includes testing for:

**Critical Vulnerabilities:**
- Remote Code Execution (RCE)
- SQL Injection
- Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
- Authentication Bypass
- Privilege Escalation
- Business Logic Flaws

**High-Impact Vulnerabilities:**
- Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
- XML External Entity (XXE)
- Insecure Deserialization
- OAuth/OIDC Misconfigurations
- Broken Access Control (IDOR)

### Out of Scope

- Denial of Service (DoS) testing
- Social engineering
- Physical security
- Third-party integrations (unless authorized)
- [Other exclusions]

---

## Deliverables

### 1. Executive Summary (PDF)
- High-level risk overview
- Critical findings summary
- Business impact assessment
- Remediation priorities

### 2. Technical Report (PDF)
- Detailed vulnerability descriptions
- Proof of Concept for each finding
- Step-by-step exploitation
- Specific remediation recommendations
- CVSS scoring

### 3. Raw Findings (JSON)
- Machine-readable findings
- Integration with your security tools
- Tracking and remediation management

### 4. Findings Review Call
- Walk through critical findings
- Answer technical questions
- Discuss remediation approaches
- Q&A session
